overview_of_class: Overview of the interactions between societies and the natural environment. Examines both key environmental problems, like climate change and oil spills, and possible solutions, and the roles played by different social structures and groups in shaping both issues.
name: Environment and Society
title: WCAS SOCIOL 212-0-20 Environment and Society

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Overview of the interactions between societies and the natural environment. Examines both key environmental problems, like climate change and oil spills, and possible solutions, and the roles played by different social structures and groups in shaping both issues.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Pre-registration is reserved for Sociology, SHC, BIP, or Global Health students. This course is open to all students during regular registration starting May 16.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
This is a tentative booklist. Please confirm before purchase:

1| Environment and Society by Robbins, Hintz and Moore

2| A course packet (to be available at Quartet)

subject: SOCIOL
